FacilityName: Valley Grain and Fertilizer Co., Inc.
OperatorName: Valley Grain and Fertilizer Co., In

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

   1. THE FACILITY POLICY

     THE OWNERS, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF VALLEY GRAIN AND FERTILIZER CO., INC., EVEREST LOCATION, ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND PROPANE.  IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE
THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRNOMENT.

   2.  FACILITY INFORMATION

      - THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACLITY IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS
     FOR SALE TO FARMERS.

      - ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION.

      - THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE 160,000 POUNDS IN TWO 12,000 GALLON
     ANHYDOUS AMMONIA STORAGE TANKS AND NURSE TANKS.

  3. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.

NONE LISTED.

      4. THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED A SAFETY PROGRAM THAT DETAILS PROPER OPERATIONS OF THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FACILITY INCLUDING STEP-BY-STEP PROCEDURES OR DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS AS WELL AS PERIODIC CHECKS TO ENSURE PROPER EQUIPMENT USE AND MAINTENANCE.  THIS PROGRAM COMPLIES WITH THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC., AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, " STORAGE AND HANDLING
OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".  IN ADDITION, THE MINNESOTA DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE AMMONIA RULES. THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENT PREVENTION RULE AND ALL APPLICABLE STATE AND LOCAL CODES AND REGULATIONS. 


      5. THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

             a. THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA OR PROPANE
        IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT:
             -  HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATHS, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY D

AMAGE AT THE 
                FACILITY; NOR
             -  TO OUR KNOWLEDGE HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS,
                SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

       6. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

             - THE FACILITY HAS:
           
              a.  A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD,
                   29 CFR 1910.38;
              b.  PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND 
                   COMMUNITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA);
              c.  COORDINATE WITH EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.

7.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.
